intro: Dorstenia ciliata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, which are often borne on long, slender stems. Dorstenia ciliata is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
